title: Acoustic evaluation of a neural network dedicated to the detection of animal vocalisations
author: J. Rouch (ENES Bioacoustics Research Lab, CNRS), M. Ducrettet (BioPhonia), S. Haupert (Institut Systématique Evolution Biodiversité), R. Emonet (Laboratoire Hubert Curien), F. Sèbe (Office Français de la Biodiversité), ...
relevance_why: This paper details neural network-based methods for audio signal detection in ecological monitoring, which may inspire methods applicable to audio processing and generation tasks in Haohe Liu's research.
background: The study focuses on enhancing detection of animal vocalizations using a convolutional neural network while evaluating performance metrics across various noise levels.
contribution: This paper introduces a method for estimating detection probability based on signal-to-noise ratios in neural networks, achieving improved models for monitoring animal populations.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on machine learning metrics like precision and recall without considering noise effects in performance evaluation.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work enhances performance evaluation by integrating acoustic analysis with machine learning metrics, providing a more comprehensive understanding of the neural network's capabilities under varying noise conditions.

key_innovation: The integration of signal-to-noise ratio analysis into neural network performance evaluation to optimize detection of specific animal vocalizations.
real_world_impact: By improving monitoring techniques in ecological studies, this research could facilitate better conservation efforts and wildlife management strategies.

new_terms.signal-to-noise ratio: **Signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)** is a measure used in science and engineering to quantify how much a signal has been corrupted by noise, expressed in decibels (dB).
new_terms.convolutional neural network: **Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)** are a class of deep neural networks that are particularly effective for processing structured grid data such as images and audio spectrograms.
